channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 12 gallons of UN1263 KAC released due to blocking, bracing and improper loading. The release impacted trailer. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.

item.title: Report E-2024060532
item.description:
Report E-2024060532

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-26T15:13:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-08
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 2-gallons of Gunwash Lacquer Thinner was released from one (1) 5-gallon metal bucket due to a small puncture at the bottom of the bucket. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they have the appropriate PPE to clean the spill and they will place the contents into a 10-gallon metal drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060482
item.description:
Report E-2024060482

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-25T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-13
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 13, 2024, two (2) 20-gallon fiber drums of UN2014 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN2014-impacted loading dock floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and the two damaged drums were put into two (2) 55-gallon poly vented drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024061194
item.description:
Report X-2024061194

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-27
  • City: MACON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: NS personnel inside Brosnan Yard (Macon, GA) reported a Chlorine release from an unidentified car. A personnel reported a strong smell of Chlorine while walking the line of tank cars. Upon inspection by a contractor, it was noted that tank car OLNX 711120 was the car that was leaking. A strong smell of chlorine was noted, audible hissing was found, degradation to the paint in the protective housing was noted. The source of the leak was found to be the Tell-Tale valve on the PRD. The valve was open. The tell-tale valve was closed and the leak stopped. The tell-tale valve leaking also indicates the rupture disc under the PRD was not intact.

item.title: Report E-2024060381
item.description:
Report E-2024060381

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-18
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding punctured plastic jugs of Bifenture (Pesticide). Four plastic jugs of product were punctured by a forklift. This resulted in an estimated release of 4-gallons of product impacting the wooden trailer floor in a 3’x3’ area and the concrete/asphalt beneath the trailer in a 20’x3’ area. A Contractor contained and clean-up the release using oil dry. The four damaged jugs were overpacked into one 55-gallon DF for waste disposal along with the impacted oil dry. No storm drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.
